item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Evil conquered?' said Gwydion. 'You have learned much, but learn this last and hardest of lessons. You have conquered only the enchantments of evil. That was the easiest of your tasks, only a beginning, not an ending. Do you believe evil itself to be so quickly overcome? Not so long as men still hate and slay each other, when greed and anger goad them. Against these even a flaming sword cannot prevail, but only that portion of good in all men's hearts whose flame can never be quenched." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Timothy Zahn
item.description: "Without trust, there can be no genuine peace. Neither in politics, nor in the quiet individuality of the heart and spirit." -- Timothy Zahn

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Ms. Wormwood: Calvin, can you tell us what Lewis and Clark did? Calvin: No, but I can recite the secret superhero origin of each member of Captain Napalm's Thermonuclear League of Liberty. Ms. Wormwood: See me after class, Calvin. Calvin: [retrospectively] I'm not dumb. I just have a command of thoroughly useless information." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "The surest sign that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe is that it has never tried to contact us." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hello Dad! It is now three in the morning. Do you know where I am? " -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Every time I've built character, I've regretted it." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hold it. You know what I'd like to see? I'd like to see the three bears eat the three little pigs, and then the bears join up with the big bad wolf and eat Goldilocks and Little Red Riding Hood! Tell me a story like that, OK?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Girls are like slugs—they probably serve some purpose, but it's hard to imagine what." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I hate to think that all my current experiences will someday become stories with no point." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "[Calvin and Hobbes are playing Scrabble.] Calvin: Ha! I've got a great word and it's on a "Double word score" box! Hobbes: "ZQFMGB" isn't a word! It doesn't even have a vowel! Calvin: It is so a word! It's a worm found in New Guinea! Everyone knows that! Hobbes: I'm looking it up. Calvin: You do, and I'll look up that 12-letter word you played with all the Xs and Js! Hobbes: What's your score for ZQFMGB? Calvin: 957." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "CALVIN: Our hero regains consciousness at the feet of a sarcastic alien." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "You must admit I have a right to live in a pigsty if I want." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "My parents are going to kill me!" "That seems rather harsh..." -- Garth Nix

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Georgette Heyer
item.description: "Randall laid his hand on Stella's, but only to remove it from his sleeve. "My precious, you really must have some regard for my clothes," he said with gentle reproach. "Much as I love you, I cannot permit you to maul this particular coat." -- Georgette Heyer

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "She will look at you as women look at men, and she will judge you as a woman judge men...not on the strength of their arguments, and not in their cleverness or prowess in battle, but rather on the force of their character, the intensity of their passion, their strength of soul, their compassion, and...ah, this above all...their conversation." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Love is finding that the things you like best about yourself are not in you at all, but in the person who completes you" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Early to bed and early to rise," Mazer intoned, "makes a man stupid and blind in the eyes." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Remember, the enemy's gate is down." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "And enough for me that when my hand touched your shoulder, you leaned on me; and when you felt me slip away, you called my name." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Because never in my entire childhood did I feel like a child. I felt like a person all along―the same person that I am today." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Human beings are free except when humanity needs them. Maybe humanity needs you. To do something. Maybe humanity needs me—to find out what you're good for. We might both do despicable things, Ender, but if humankind survives, then we were good tools." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Into the the air, into the earth, into the fire, I am with you." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tatianna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I don't care if I pass your test, I don't care if I follow your rules. If you can cheat, so can I. I won't let you beat me unfairly - I'll beat you unfairly first. - Ender " -- Orson Scott Card
